intro: Dorstenia ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru mountain fig, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often tubular leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
